p: Subcritical n‐butane extracts of Cinnamomum species were much more sensitive to foodborne pathogens than ethanol extracts, especially for C. cassia and C. loureiroi. It can be attributed to the presence of the principle bioactive constituents, especially ( E)‐cinnamaldehyde. Subcritical n‐butane extracts of C. cassia and C. loureiroi could be potential candidates to be used as natural alternatives for further application in food preservation to extend the shelf life of food products.
